description: Application for Minor Material Amendment (S73) to vary condition 2 (approved plans) of planning permission ref. 177383FUL dated 09/07/2018 for Change of use to part ground floor from restaurant/caf√© (A3 Use Class) to residential (C3 Use Class) and conversion of existing residential building to accommodate a total of six self-contained flats including associated amenity space, cycle storage and refuse storage provision; and part single storey, two storey and three storey side and rear extensions (following demolition of single storey side and rear extensions). Variation is seeking to amend site boundary, increase width of building at rear, increase size of flat roof extension above original building and associated internal alterations
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of 09 July 2018, when permission was granted.
Reason:  In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Location Plan ref. 1706/MIN/01; Existing Ground Floor Plan (As Approved) ref. 1706C/MIN/03; Existing First Floor Plan (As Approved) ref. 1706C/MIN/04; Existing Second Floor Plan (As Approved) ref. 1706C/MIN/05; Existing Roof Plan (As Approved) ref. 1706C/MIN/06; Existing Front Elevation (As Approved) ref. 1706C/MIN/07; Existing Rear Elevation (As Approved) ref. 1706C/MIN/08; Proposed Ground Floor Plan ref. 1706C/MIN/09A; Proposed First Floor Plan ref. 1706C/MIN/10A; Proposed Second Floor Plan ref. 1706C/MIN/11B, received 01 November 2018; Proposed Roof Plan ref. 1706C/MIN/12; Proposed Rear Elevation ref. 1706C/MIN/13; Existing Side Elevation plan ref. 1706C/MIN/14.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Ensure refuse and recycling storage are provided; the bin area is locked and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development hereby approved shall ensure the external noise levels from transport and industrial/ commercial sources and the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing and acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building) achieves internal room- and (if provided) external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Ensure the cycle stands within secure and sheltered storage are provided in accordance with approved details ref. 183561CND dated 18 October 2018, prior to the commencement of the development.

Reason:  In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Details including samples of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and Policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
